text:
Hi Sam,
I took a look at your portfolio and it looks really cool to me. I don’t have much experience working as matte painter or photobashing. It’s surely an approach that is more required for feature films or games.  To be honest the quality that I see it looks at a professional level to me. Have you thought about including more 3D model/environment works or character samples? Showing some blocking in a 3D software (I don’t know which one you can use ) and then the final 2D artwork. Also having a page for realistic props could help and show that you can develop and design them.

Thanks for the feedback. Yeah I’ve noticed photobashing techniques tend to be used for feature film and games over other industries. 

Regarding 3d models - Do you think showing work in progress blockouts would be a benefit? I’m using SketchUp for blocking at the moment. So I could include more of that to show development. 

I feel my portfolio lacks showing my work process / development and only displays the final concept. So maybe more thumbnail sketches and test compositions would be good to include?

absolutely! you can include thumbnails, sketches for environments , how you develop the image. Just remember to put at the beginning your best works and avoid the ones you’re not sure about if you have.
I think as long as it doesn’t take one full page just for the Sketchup model, I think is good to show!
